title: Test
yAxis: Ratio of government expenditure to GDP
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Ratio of government expenditure to GDP, with a total of 11 data points.
Overall Ratio of government expenditure to GDP has decreased over the Year
Ratio of government expenditure to GDP is slightly constant from 2014 to 2024.
The steepest stays the same occurs in between the Year 2019 and 2020.
Max Ratio of government expenditure to GDP about 25.96 was recorded at Year 2014
Min Ratio of government expenditure to GDP about 20.35 was recorded at Year 2024
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Ratio of government expenditure to GDP, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2014 to 2017.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2022 to 2024.
Differently, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2019 to 2021.
Differently, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2017 to 2019.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2021 to 2022.
